MiAIRR content definition: Unique ID assigned by study registry
Descriptive study title
Field value example: Effects of sun light exposure of the Treg repertoire

MiAIRR content definition: Generic study design
List of criteria for inclusion/exclusion for the study
Field value example: Include: Clinical P. falciparum infection; Exclude: Seropositive for HIV

MiAIRR content definition: Funding agencies and grant numbers
Full contact information of the corresponding author, i.e. who is legally responsible for data collection and release. This should include an e-mail address.
Department of corresponding author
Institutional address of corresponding author
Field value example: School of Medicine, Unseen University, Ankh-Morpork, Disk World

MiAIRR content definition: Full contact information of the submitter, i.e. the person deposition the data
Publications describing the rationale and/or outcome of the study
Subject ID assigned by submitter, unique within study
TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (e.g. phage display)
Binomial designation of subject's species
Biological sex of subject
Absolute age of subject at time point `Age event`

Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers to. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.
Broad geographic origin of ancestry (continent)
Field value example: list of continents, mixed or unknown

MiAIRR content definition: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership)
Field value example: English, Kurds, Manchu, Yakuts (and other fields from Wikipedia)

MiAIRR content definition: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH)
Field value example: White, American Indian or Alaska Native, Black, Asian, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, Other

MiAIRR content definition: Non-human: designation of the strain or breed of animal used
Subject ID to which `Relation type` refers to
Relation between subject and `linked_subjects`, can be genetic or environmental (e.g.exposure)
Designation of study arm to which the subject is assigned to
Diagnosis of subject
Time duration between initial diagnosis and current intervention
Stage of disease at current intervention

MiAIRR field designation: Prior therapies for primary disease under study
MiAIRR content definition: List of all relevant previous therapies applied to subject for treatment of `Diagnosis`
Antigen, vaccine or drug applied to subject at this intervention
Description of intervention
Medical history of subject that is relevant to assess the course of disease and/or treatment
Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study
The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture
The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood
The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur
Histopathologic evaluation of the sample
Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `Collection time event`
Event in the study schedule to which `Sample collection time` relates to
Name and address of the entity providing the sample
Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample
Field value example: Collagenase A/Dnase I digested, followed by Percoll gradient

MiAIRR content definition: Commonly-used designation of isolated cell population
List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population
TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments
Total number of cells that went into the experiment

MiAIRR field designation: Number of cells per sequencing reaction
MiAIRR content definition: Number of cells for each biological repicate
TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing
Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing
Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells
Field value example: Cells were stained with fluorochrome labeled antibodies and then sorted on a FlowMerlin (CE) cytometer

MiAIRR content definition: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript
The class of nucleic acid that was used as starting material for the following procedures
Description and results of the quality control performed on the source material
Generic type of library generation
Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing
Designation of the target locus according to standard gene nomencleature
Field value example: Constant region vs. V region amplification

MiAIRR content definition: Position of the most distal nucleotide templated by the forward primer or primer mix
Position of the most proximal nucleotide templated by the reverse primer or primer mix

To be considered `complete`, a sequences MUST 1) include the first V segment codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence); 2) include the last complete codon of the J segment (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site); 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation.
Describes the mode of linkage if a method was used which physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct loci in a single-cell context
Amount of substrate that went into the process
Number of usable reads for analysis
When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number
Designation of sequencing instrument used
Read length in bases for each direction
Name and address of sequencing facility
ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility
Date of sequencing run
Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit
Sequence and quality score of all passing reads
Version number and / or date, include company pipelines
How paired end reads were assembled into a single receptor sequence
How sequences were removed from (4) based on base quality scores
How primers were identified in the sequences, were they removed/masked/etc?
The method used for combining multiple sequences from (4) into a single sequence in (5)
General description of how QC is performed
Databases used for VDJC gene annotation plus date of retrieval / version
User-specified ID for the cell from which the sequence was obtained
V segment gene and allele
D segment gene and allele
J segment gene and allele
Constant region gene and allele
Nucleotide sequence of the IMGT-JUNCTION
Amino acid sequence of the IMGT-JUNCTION
Number of reads used to build sequence
